Dialogue.content: Hi! I'm Omar Khalid. It's my first time here.
Hello, Omar! Welcome! It's great to meet you. How can I assist you today?
I'm feeling a bit frustrated with my international relations class.
I'm sorry to hear that. What's been especially frustrating?
I was excited about this group project on global humanitarian efforts, but one teammate, Alex, seems completely disengaged.
That sounds challenging. Have you discussed your concerns with Alex?
Hey, I'm back. Things are getting complicated.
Welcome back, Omar! What's been going on?
I tried to encourage Alex to share his thoughts, but he dismissed me completely, saying he was too busy. Now I'm anxious about leading the group.
That's really tough. It's natural to feel anxious in that situation. How have you been managing those feelings?
I've been trying to take more control, but I keep doubting if I can motivate anyone.
It's understandable to feel overwhelmed when you want to ensure everyone is engaged. Have you thought about reaching out to the rest of your group for support?
Hi. I'm feeling really burnt out right now.
Hi Omar. I'm here to help. What's been contributing to your burnout?
With the deadline approaching, I've been working late trying to cover for Alex and others. During our last rehearsal, I stumbled through my presentation. I felt so embarrassed.
That sounds incredibly tough, especially when you've put in so much effort. Have you communicated how you're feeling to your team?
No, I don't want to add more pressure or seem weak. I just feel so isolated.
I finally opened up to my family about my experience, and they encouraged me to speak with my team.
I'm glad to hear that, Omar! How did that conversation go?
I feel a bit relieved talking about it, but I'm still conflicted about how to approach my teammates. I want to address it without causing more tension.
That's very thoughtful of you. Remember that honesty can often lead to a better understanding. What do you think you'll say to them?
I think I need to express my feelings honestly but respectfully. It's just hard to find the right words.
Take your time to gather your thoughts. Perhaps jot down some points you want to cover. I believe you can facilitate a meaningful conversation.
